title: Candleholder, 1766
markings: Four marks underneath. Amsterdam, date letter, G (maker?), "VCB"; one undecipherable on rim. V on shield under crown control mark?
provenance: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Three branched candelabrum in form of an oak tree. Base outlined by three reverse curves; column represents a tree trunk (from which the lower branches have been cut) with leaves at the top and four twisting branches; three of the branches have acorns serving as sockets for candles. The section above the leaves is removable.

tombstone.epitaph: Candleholder, 1766. Cast, molded, and raised silver. Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1926-37-130-a/h.
